course.title: PSY 4180 Human Neuropsychology (3 units)
course.desc: Physiological basis for the major motor, perceptual and cognitive brain systems. Case studies of the major syndromes associated with focal lesions of the brain and overview of the methods used to delineate the functional impairments and sparing following brain insults. Current research in human neuropsychology.Course Component: LecturePrerequisite: 81 university units including PSY 1101, PSY 1102, PSY 2301, PSY 3301. Reserved for students registered in the Joint Honours and Honours programs in psychology.
